intro: Betonica peraucta, commonly known as the greater betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to violet flowers during the summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Betonica peraucta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
